titles.title: Railroad Safety Act of 1987
A bill to amend the Hazardous Materials Transportation Act to place certain restrictions on the transportation of radioactive waste and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Transportation, Tourism, and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: 4/22/1987--Introduced. Railroad Safety Act of 1987 - Amends the Hazardous Materials Transportation Act to prohibit radioactive waste from being transported by rail through any high-density metropolitan area. Authorizes the Secretary of Transportation to allow rail transportation of such waste through such an area when no reasonable alternative route is available. Requires the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to require 30 days' notice of the shipment of nuclear waste, and to require that such notice be published in the Federal Register.
